item.title: European car safety agency snubs BYD's Atto 3 driver assistance system
item.description: The model scored zero on driver monitoring features and performed poorly in preventing undertaking at speeds over 90 kilometres per hour (56 miles per hour), among other shortcomings, according to the Oct. 23 report from the European New Car Assessment Programme (Euro NCAP).

item.title: India's EV pioneer Maini Group ventures into autonomous tech with SiMa.ai partnership
item.description: Maini Group, known for launching India’s first EV in the 1990s, has long been committed to electrifying in-plant machinery, particularly within the Class 3 segment of the material handling industry.

item.title: Mexico warns US ban on Chinese car tech could hurt automotive industry
item.description: Mexico's economy ministry said in a filing with the U.S. Commerce Department the proposal could have a "substantial impact on Mexico's automotive industry. Economically, it poses potential trade barriers, disruptions to supply chains, increased production costs, and a possible risk of reduced direct and indirect employment."

item.title: Ford pauses F-150 Lightning production as Tesla Cybertruck heats up
item.description:
Ford will pause production of its F-150 Lightning electric pickup truck starting in mid-November for almost two months as it struggles with decreased demand, increased competition, and losses in its electric vehicle business.  “We continue to adjust production for an optimal mix of sales growth and profitability,” a Ford spokesperson told TechCrunch. The news was […]

item.title: Zoox robotaxis are finally rolling out, Waymo snags more cash, and Aurora delays its self-driving truck launch
item.description:

item.title: Chinese EV maker BYD's quarterly sales overtook Tesla's for the first time
item.description: The milestone comes amid tough competition in China, the world's largest auto market, as well as higher tariffs on imports of Chinese EVs into the EU.

item.title: Dodge maker Stellantis posts 27% drop in revenues, flags progress in slashing U.S. inventories
item.description: Auto giant Stellantis on Thursday reported a 27% decline in third-quarter revenues, but said it was making headway in addressing operational issues like U.S. inventories.

item.title: Stellantis reports slump in car sales as European demand falls
item.description:
Owner of Fiat, Chrysler and Peugeot brands pushes back against rules that force sale of more electric vehicles

  • Business live – latest updates

The owner of car brands including Fiat, Chrysler and Peugeot has reported a steep fall in sales, blaming production delays and flagging European demand.

Stellantis reported revenues on Thursday of €33bn (£27.6bn) for the July to September quarter, a drop of 27% compared with the same period a year earlier.

Continue reading...
